data.title: A nation of rabbits
data.statement:
You need to find the number of rabbits there will be at year [[n]], given the initial number [[nb]] of rabbits at <<year 0>>. To simplify things, there are no males and females: every rabbit gives birth to [[g]] rabbits per year.

<<But be careful, because:>>
1. Rabbits only give birth during the first <<{{2}}>> years of their lives.
2. Rabbits only live <<{{4}}>> years (the initial rabbits are dead at year 4).

Some examples:
In: 1 2 1  (which means: return the number of rabbits at year 1, given that there are 2 rabbits at year 0 and each rabbit gives birth to 1 rabbit per year) 
Out: 4

In: 3 2 2 
Out: 50
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int nb:int g:int
write answer
data.inputDescription: Three integers [[n]], [[nb]] and [[g]] giving you the <<number of years>>, the <<initial number of rabbits>> and the <<number of new rabbits>> per rabbit each year.
data.outputDescription: The number of rabbits after [[n]] years.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to find the number of rabbits there will be at year n, given the initial number nb of rabbits at year 0. To simplify things, there are no males and females: every rabbit gives birth to g rabbits per year.

But be careful, because:
1. Rabbits only give birth during the first 2 years of their lives.
2. Rabbits only live 4 years (the initial rabbits are dead at year 4).

Some examples:
In: 1 2 1 (which means: return the number of rabbits at year 1, given that there are 2 rabbits at year 0 and each rabbit gives birth to 1 rabbit per year)
Out: 4

In: 3 2 2
Out: 50
Input
Three integers n, nb and g giving you the number of years, the initial number of rabbits and the number of new rabbits per rabbit each year.
Output
The number of rabbits after n years.
Constraints
0 < n ≤ 10
0 < nb ≤ 10
0 < g ≤ 10
Example
Input
1 2 1
Output
4
